DynatraceUEM

             throws java.lang.RuntimeException

Throws:

Method Detail

startup

public static int startup(android.content.Context context,
                          java.lang.String sApplId,
                          java.lang.String agentPath,
                          boolean useAnyCert,
                          java.security.KeyStore keyStore)
Initializing the ADK for capturing and reporting data. It is recommended that this method be invoked as early as possible in your application startup sequence.

Parameters:
context - Android application context
sApplId - Application ID
agentPath - the path to the placed UEM agent (eg: "http://myhost.mydomain.com:8080/myApplication") see UEM configuration in the dynaTrace client; don't forget to include the transport mechanism (http or https)
useAnyCert - allow any certificate for https communication
keyStore - the key store holding the certificate(s) for SSL communications; this parameter will only be used if the agentPath specifies HTTPS and useAnyCert is false; if you specify null then the device's default key store will be used
Returns:
CPWR_UemOn, CPWR_Error_InvalidParameter

shutdown

public static void shutdown()
Call when the application wants the ADK to stop collecting data. The ADK will try to flush pending events for up 5 seconds.

uemCaptureStatus

public static int uemCaptureStatus()
Get the current UEM data capture state

Returns:
CPWR_Error_NotInitialized, CPWR_UemOn, CPWR_UemOff

public static int setGpsLocation(android.location.Location location)
Saves the given GPS location for reporting along with the captured data.

Parameters:
location - to be saved
Returns:
CPWR_UemOn

getRequestTagHeader

public static java.lang.String getRequestTagHeader()
Returns the dynaTrace request tag header name to be used in conjunction with the value returned by getRequestTag().

Returns:
the request tag header name

getRequestTag

public static java.lang.String getRequestTag()
getRequestTagHeader() and this method provides a way to tag a web request when you cannot use DynatraceUEM.tagRequest(HttpGet) or DynatraceUEM.tagRequest(HttpURLConnection).

Returns:
the request tag (which is specific to a given logic path) or an empty string if the ADK is not active
See Also:
getRequestTagHeader()

tagRequest

public static int tagRequest(java.net.HttpURLConnection conn)
Sets a request tag (i.e. the dynaTrace request header) on a web request (to be executed by the connection), which is evaluated by the dynaTrace server in order to correlate a web request to an action if possible. Since there is no explicit action, the web request is correlated to an action according to the following rule: (1) the web request is assigned to an open action in the current thread if there is one at the time the request is tagged; (2) if there is no open action in the current thread, the web request is assigned to an action that calls its leave() method in the current thread at the time the request is tagged; (3) if neither case, the web request is not assigned to any action.

Parameters:
conn - the request tag will be added as header to the connection
Returns:
CPWR_UemOn, CPWR_UemOff, CPWR_Error_NotInitialized
See Also:
#tagRequest(HttpGet)

tagRequest

public static int tagRequest(org.apache.http.HttpRequest request)
Like tagRequest(HttpURLConnection) but applied to an HttpGet, HttpPost, etc.

Parameters:
request - the request tag will be added as header to the request
Returns:
CPWR_UemOn, CPWR_Error_NotInitialized, CPWR_UemOff
See Also:
tagRequest(HttpURLConnection)

registerRequestTaggingInterceptor

public static int registerRequestTaggingInterceptor(org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultHttpClient client)
This method registers a HttpRequestInterceptor for the given DefaultHttpClient object. Effectively, before a request is sent by the client, the intercepter automatically tags the request as described in the methods tagRequest(HttpURLConnection conn) and tagRequest(HttpGet request). Note that you may call this method only once per DefaultHttpClient object!

Parameters:
client - a DefaultHttpClient object
Returns:
DynatraceUEM.CPWR_UemOn, otherwise one of the following: DynatraceUEM.CPWR_Error_InvalidParameter, DynatraceUEM.CPWR_Error_NotInitialized, DynatraceUEM.CPWR_UemOff

enterAction

public static UemAction enterAction(java.lang.String actionName)

findAction

public UemAction findAction(java.lang.String id)

endVisit

public static int endVisit()
endVisit can be called to end the current visit and start a new visit. This will flush all pending events to the dynaTrace server.

Returns:
DynatraceUEM.CPWR_UemOn if the visit is ended successfully, CPWR_Error_NotInitialized if DynatraceUEM has not been initialized

reportError

public static int reportError(java.lang.String errorName,
                              int errorCode)
The Report Error event reports a user-defined integer value at any user-defined time in the application lifecycle. The Report Error event is different from the Custom (integer) Value event in that it is specifically identified as an error type of event. The integer value would most likely contain an error code. Note that this method reports the error outside of the context of an action.

Parameters:
errorName - 1 to 240 character error name
errorCode - integer error code
Returns:
DynatraceUEM.CPWR_UemOn, otherwise one of the following: DynatraceUEM.CPWR_Error_InvalidParameter, DynatraceUEM.CPWR_Error_NotInitialized, DynatraceUEM.CPWR_UemOff, DynatraceUEM.CPWR_ReportErrorOff

reportError

public static int reportError(java.lang.String errorName,
                              java.lang.Throwable throwable)
The Report Error event reports a throwable or handled exception at any user-defined time in the application lifecycle. The Report Error event is different from the Custom (string) Value event or reportEvent in that it is specifically identified as an error type of event. The throwable would most likely be a handled exception. Note that this method reports the error outside of the context of an action.

Parameters:
errorName - 1 to 240 character error name
throwable - a caught exception
Returns:
DynatraceUEM.CPWR_UemOn, otherwise one of the following: DynatraceUEM.CPWR_Error_InvalidParameter, DynatraceUEM.CPWR_Error_NotInitialized, DynatraceUEM.CPWR_UemOff, DynatraceUEM.CPWR_ReportErrorOff

enableCrashReporting

public static void enableCrashReporting(boolean sendCrashData)
Install the Dynatrace UEM crash handler to report crashes, i.e., uncaught exception in application threads. In the event of an uncaught exception, the UEM crash handler will process the exception for reporting and pass on the exception to the default uncaught exception handler. Note: a crash is only processed and reported if the ADK is initialized and active. A crash event is still generated even when the crash data is not sent

Parameters:
sendCrashData - True to send crash data but can be overridden from dynaTrace client or by dynaTrace server; false not to send crash data and cannot be overridden.

flushEvents

public static void flushEvents()
Call this function to flush all collected events immediately.

setMonitorCookie

public static void setMonitorCookie(java.lang.String cookieString)
Define a cookie string to be sent along with every HTTP GET/POST method call made by this ADK (when establishing contact with the backend or sending data to it). The use of this method is not typical. If called, this method must be invoked before the startup is called to ensure prompt and successful contact with the backend. It can be invoked again to change the cookie string thereafter.

Parameters:
cookieString - The cookie string e.g., "MIGRATION_FLAG=3" or "n1=v1; n2=v2". If null or empty, the cookie is nullified.

registerWebView

public static boolean registerWebView(android.webkit.WebView webView)
Register a web view so that Java scripts (intended to be executed in the web view) can be instrumented with this ADK. Each web view must be registered separately. Note that a call to this method will result in enabling javascript execution in the registered web views. Furthermore, 'blanket web request tagging' using the javascript function startTaggingRequests also enables the CookieManager to accept cookies..

Parameters:
webView - A web view in which instrumented Java scripts to be executed
Returns:
True if successful

getWebRequestTiming

public static WebRequestTiming getWebRequestTiming(java.lang.String tag)
This represents a network timing instance for reporting the time elapsed between two user-defined events.

You must call startWebRequestTiming() to start and stopWebRequestTiming() to complete the timing.

See the wiki for instructions on tagging and timing network requests.

Parameters:
tag - - An String tag generated by DynatraceUEM.getRequestTag()
Returns:
a non-null WebRequestTiming instance

getWebRequestTiming

public static WebRequestTiming getWebRequestTiming(java.net.HttpURLConnection connection)
This represents a network timing instance for reporting the time elapsed between two user-defined events.

You must call startWebRequestTiming() to start and stopWebRequestTiming() to complete the timing.

See the wiki for instructions on tagging and timing network requests.

Parameters:
connection - - a non-null HttpURLConnection instance
Returns:
a non-null WebRequestTiming instance

getWebRequestTiming

public static WebRequestTiming getWebRequestTiming(org.apache.http.HttpRequest request)
This represents a network timing instance for reporting the time elapsed between two user-defined events.

You must call startWebRequestTiming() to start and stopWebRequestTiming() to complete the timing.

See the wiki for instructions on tagging and timing network requests.

Parameters:
request - - a non-null HttpRequest instance
Returns:
a non-null WebRequestTiming instance

setCookiesForDomain

public static int setCookiesForDomain(java.lang.String domain)
This feature is for hybrid apps making web requests from a WebView to multiple servers running Dynatrace agents. By default, tracking cookies are set for the agentPath used to call DynatraceUEM#startup(). XHR requests made from the WebView to that system will have tracking cookies added.

If the WebView makes requests to other systems, their domains will have to be added here. You will need to call this method once for each domain you need to add.

Note: This must be called before startup(Context, String, String, boolean, KeyStore) or the cookies will not be set.

  • To set a domain-level cookie, use .company.com
  • To set a subdomain-level cookie, use .subdomain.company.com
  • To set a server-specific cookie, use server.company.com
  • To set a cookie for an IP address, use the IP address of that system

Parameters:
domain - The domain or server for which tracking cookies will be set
Returns:
DynatraceUEM.CPWR_UemOn, DynatraceUEM.CPWR_Error_InvalidParameter
